title: Volvo Group - global number of employees 2003 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of employees, with a total of 16 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2007 to 2003.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2012 to 2009.
Also, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2016 to 2014.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2014 to 2012.
Differently, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2009 to 2007.
gold: This statistic represents the global number of Volvo Group employees from 2002 to 2018 . In 2018 , the Volvo Group had around 105,175 employees worldwide . This figure is considerably lower than that of other vehicle manufacturers : General Motors employed around 180,000 people in 2017 .
